name: Quality Inn Finger Lakes Region

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights to visit family. The pool was closed which was a bummer. It would have been good for the kids. Our room was old and badly in need of renovation. It was early 80s era decor. It WAS clean. The front desk staff was friendly but we didn't really need to use them except for checking in and out. We only paid $71/night (AAA rate) which I thought was appropriate for the Quality. Hopefully, they will renovate soon.
reviews.title: Maybe not as bad as reviewed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here for a wedding. We were ready for bed when I noticed what looked like spots of dried blood on the extra blanket. It was about 2 am when I called the front desk to report the problem and she asked if I could bring it to her because she was alone. I was in pj's, so I waited for about 1/2 hour for her to pick up the blanket. About 15 minutes later she returned with a 'clean' blanket. When I looked at it, it had the same spots in the same place (I had taken digital photos of the original blanket so I could see it was the same blanket!) Needless to say, I didn't bother to call again, nor did I use that blanket!
reviews.title: Recycled dirty blanket!

reviews.text: We had a terrible experience with our stay. We were there for a racing banquet for kids and we had dirty clothes of someone elses left in our room. There was still stuff from NY's Eve in the dresser drawers. The staff at the bar/banquet facility was very rude and would not be flexible for any amount being our racing clubs basically was it for the people at the motel or evening staying there over night. We were qouted a "discounted rate" to find out it was not a discount price at all. The manager never bothered to call us to apologize even after I stressed my dissatisfaction with the stay when I asked for clean sheets so I can change our beds myself and or when I stated the issues when I checked out. Then we were told there was a pool which is the main reason for the kids to be entertained to find out in January that the pool had been closed since Oct.
reviews.title: Quality is not the right name....

reviews.text: The hotel was dirty-filthy carpets, dusty furniture. Broken down fixtures. Looks like the place hasn't been updated in 40 years. Very depressing to stay here. I suspect the $89 a night price was because of family weekend at a nearby college, when in reality it should be charging no more than $39 night...and still thats alot. Don't stay here whatever you do!
reviews.title: Rundown and Dirty

reviews.text: i must start by saying the receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful i have to give credit for that.We got to our rooms we had no ligh bulbs in neither of the 4 lamps in the room. tv was not working they had switch the tv from another room. they avertise continental breakfasr and theres none. The back door was constantly left open where anyone outside of the hotel can come in. Last but NOT least the pillows had a smell as if the pillow cases were not change from he previous person who stayed in my room.I read that in order to conserve they can redo your bed again without changing your sheets so i guess in my room thats what they did since they have people stay for only 1 night.The area was nice and restaurant . will i stay there again? dont think so.
reviews.title: not the quality inn i have experience before
Terrible experience
reviews.text: Stayed here on a trip to Rochester, surprised that hotel was so rundown etc, and then it hit me we stayed here in Oct 2001 to visit son at RIT, and they had a function by the pool that was so loud , the management answer, (they rented the space and would be over by midnight) guests were leaving and we cut our stay from 3- 1 night, desk clerk could have cared less beware may be only game in town but keep going until the next town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there on a very quiet night and the manager very kindly gave us an upgrade to a King Suite with a whirlpool/jacuzzi tub because the pool was closed. VERY nice room - loved it - the jacuzzi appeared to be new within the last year and was nicely installed. With two TVs we both got to watch what we wanted. And two bathrooms is an advantage as well! The front desk staff was very accommodating and nice. The place was very quiet.
reviews.title: Very nice - loved the suite!

reviews.text: Room was clean and nicely decorated - not sure what all the complaints are about.
reviews.title: Just about the only place to stay in town

reviews.text: The only complaint is that the internet wasn't working, a disappointment but we were OK without.
reviews.title: Rude Staff - NO privacy or confidentiality

reviews.text: We'd definitely go back. And we're FUSSY!!!
reviews.title: STAY AWAY

reviews.text: I am currently paying $117 + tax to stay at this dump. I have stayed at nicer Econo Lodges for half the price. The doors connecting the rooms are so thin I actually heard the person next door unzipping their suitcase. Not a place for light sleepers. Chairs in the rooms are old and stained and the tables are so old and loose that they spin. Don't expect to watch TV if you stay on the second floor. The TV's are so old that half the time it's just snow. I know this because I asked to move my room because I wanted to watch MNF and my second room was only marginally better. In the last 4 hours I've been in 3 rooms and they all need to be renovated badly. The only reason I rated this hotel a 2 instead of a 1 is because of the folks at the front desk. They are excellent. Kind and very helpful.
reviews.title: Unbelievably overpriced

reviews.text: Hotel was clean, rooms were clean and nicely painted with an updated tv, has a nicely maintained pool but overall the entire hotel needs updating! There was ample parking. The hotel is convenient to some restaurants and some shopping. Style is still from the 70's. Wireless internet is poor at best (approx 40% signal), with no option for network hard wire connection in the room. Outlets in the room were very worn and would not hold my phone plug-in or computer plug-in. Restaurant at the hotel was closed most days and nights. "The free coffee at the entrance was either cold or was empty. I did get a cup of luke warm coffee one evening. I did not try after the 3rd day to get coffee from the front entrance. Back entrance door did not lock because the door is very worn and locking mechanism does not work.
reviews.title: Needs updating

reviews.text: My companion and I stayed here two nights as we were attending a nearby family function.
reviews.title: A horrible and outdated fleabag motel by a smelly canal"

reviews.text: A room with a saggy kingsized bed was $140. Firstly, the "Quality"(and I use this term very loosely) Inn had WIFi only in certain areas, no free continental breakfast, and some surly people at the front desk that ran outside for a smoke whenever possible.
reviews.title: I wish there was another hotel

reviews.text: The ice machine did not work, the pool water looked dirty and the room itself
reviews.title: Horribly annoyed
Definate Bed Bugs
reviews.text: I do not know where to start, this place is a DUMP and the only name hotel in town, I read that there were bed bugs here, then checked the bed bug registry and did not see any reports filed, I checked in and inspected the mattress, headboard and picture frames, did not see any evidence of bed bugs. My sister joined me there and we spent 2 nights. On the second morning, my sister got up and pointed at a little bug and said what is that. I pulled back the sheets, there were 2 more...DO NOT STAY HERE. We spent the next several hours, bagging up our things, going to the pharmacy to buy bed bug spray and researching what to do...We wound up buying new outfits and either washing for throwing out everything we had with us.

Stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to Brantling Ski Area. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The room was clean and smelled OK. Not a lot of traffic noise, yet found some garbage under the bed. Not a big deal, and would most likely return for the skiing next year.
reviews.title: Decent and convenient

reviews.text: Came to NY to visit Family and thought we would give it a try after hearing that it underwent renovations. We were surprised at how much the rooms were, and they were dirty and smelled damp. We had to wait a few minutes to get a room due to the fact that the Lady at the desk was on the phone, and wouldn't acknowledge us. We decided to eat at the Restaraunt, had a rude little waitress and waited 45 minutes for food that was horrible and over priced. We decided later in the evening to get a cocktail at the pub, and I tell you, the Baetender had the mouth of a sailor and was rude, and couldn't even make a drink. My wife and watched as the Bartender served the Waitress we had Alcohol, and we knew she wasn't of age. We asked the Bartender about wines and she pointed to a shelf and walked away. I would not recommend staying here,eating here or even drinking here.The staff is rude and mouthy,and the Hotel is run down and dank
reviews.title: Slum Hotel
Two words ... BED BUGS
reviews.text: My stay turned into a nightmare. I woke up very early feeling itchie and found I wasn't alone in the bed, there were bed bugs!

The staff was friendly however our group reserved 4 rooms and our room had no microwave or fridge and an old tv. The other rooms had flat screen the those amenities. Would have been nice if we all the same room set up since the rate was the same. Pool heat was broke and dining/bar getting remodeled. Overall it was ok but not the best hotel Ive stayed.
reviews.title: Ok but not great

aka: Quality Inn Finger Lakes Region Hotel
